greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the smallest m such that m > A005235(n) and A002110(n)+m is prime.
comment: a(n) is the second m (first m is A005235(n)) such that m > 1 and A002110(n)+m is prime. I guess every term of this sequence (compare the conjecture about A005235) is prime. I checked this conjecture for n < 373.
reference: R. K. Guy, Unsolved Problems in Number Theory, Section A2.
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200
mathematica: A005235[n_] := (For[m=2, !PrimeQ[Product[Prime[k], {k, n}]+m], m++ ]; m); a[n_] := (For[m=A005235[n]+1, !PrimeQ[Product[Prime[k], {k, n}]+m], m++ ]; m); Table[a[n], {n, 60}]
results.author: _Farideh Firoozbakht_, Aug 26 2003
